author: Harriet Torry
title: U.S. Consumer Spending Rises in December as Incomes Improve - WSJ
text:
WASHINGTONâ€”U.S. consumers increased spending in the final month of last year as their incomes improved, and they saved at the lowest rate since 2005.
The 2.4% saving rate in December hit a new low for this expansion, as high asset prices and the prospect of lower taxes enticed consumers to spend more. The rate was last lower in September 2005.
